original: Öhlin, Paul Gustaf, lektor. Skara, f. 27/6/87 i Böne, Älvsb. 1., av folkskodl. Alfred Ö. o. Albertina Josefina Zachri-son. G. 1. 18 m. Ulla-Lisa Bager-Sjö-gren, d. 25; 2. 41 m. Karin Nauclér. Barn: Ulla f. 20, g. m. tekn. stud. Erik Norberg. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 09, fil. kand. i Lund 13, fil. mag. 14, fil. lic. 17, fil. dr 18 samt provår 20-21. Vik. adj. i Lund 16-17, timlär. v. Lunds fullst. lärov. f. fl. 16-18, e. o. lektor i Eksjö ht. 19, lär. v. Lunds priv. elem:-sk. 21-26, lektor i hist. o. modersm. v. Skara h. a. 1. sed. 25. Ordf. i komm:-stämma o. flera komm. ndr i Ormes-berga 19-23, självskr. led. av Skara domkap. 25-36, däreft. utn. av K. Maj :t, led. av Skara kyrkofullm. 3’2-46, lokalstyr. f. lärov. sed. 33, drätsel-kamm. 36-43, stadsfullm. 38-46, styr. f. stifts- o. landsbibi. sed. 43; insp. f. Skara föreläsn :fören. sed. 35, v. ordf. i styr. f. komm. flicksk. sed. 44. Res. t. Norge, Danm., Tyskl., Engl, Frankr. o. Schw^eiz. Skr.: Stud. över de passiva konstruktionerna i fornsv. (grad :avh. 18), Kringlarpssläkten (37), art. o rec. RNO.
translated:
Öhlin, Paul Gustaf, lecturer. Skara, born June 27, 1887 in Böne, Älvsborg County, son of elementary school teacher Alfred Ö. and Albertina Josefina Zachrisson. Married 1. in 1918 to Ulla-Lisa Bager-Sjögren, died in 1925; 2. in 1941 to Karin Nauclér. Children: Ulla, born in 1920, married to engineering student Erik Norberg. 

Education: graduated from high school in Malmö in 1909, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1913, Master of Arts in 1914, Licentiate in Philosophy in 1917, Doctor of Philosophy in 1918, and completed a probationary year in 1920-21. Acting assistant professor in Lund from 1916-1917, substitute teacher at Lunds fullständiga läroverk from 1916-1918, acting lecturer in Eksjö in autumn 1919, teacher at Lunds private elementary school from 1921-1926, lecturer in history and mother tongue at Skara högre allmänna läroverk since 1925. 

Chairman of the municipal meeting and several municipal boards in Ormesberga from 1919-1923, self-elected member of the Skara Cathedral Chapter from 1925-1936, subsequently appointed by the Royal Majesty, member of the Skara Church Council from 1932-1946, local government board for schools since 1933, municipal finance committee from 1936-1943, city council member from 1938-1946, board of the diocese and county library since 1943; inspector for Skara lecture association since 1935, vice-chairman of the board for the municipal girls' school since 1944. 

Traveled to Norway, Denmark, Germany, England, France, and Switzerland. Written works: "Studies on Passive Constructions in Old Swedish" (doctoral dissertation, 1918), "Kringlarps Family" (1937), articles and reviews in the Royal Society of Sciences.

works.name: Stud. över de passiva konstruktionerna i fornsv.
works.alternateName: Studies on Passive Constructions in Old Swedish
